results.title: Dot and the Koala
results.brief_description: Dot and the Koala opens with the residents of a small Australian country town desperately wanting to lead more exciting, more modern lives. Major Percy Pig convinces the townspeople - a strange collection of haughty cows, hardworking horses and aggressive dogs - that the answer to their problems is a massive dam. The dam will provide the power to catapult the town into the 21st century. When the native animals - kangaroos, wombats and possums - realise the dam will destroy vast tracts of the countryside, open warfare erupts between the two groups.

images.caption: Dot and the Koala (Yoram Gross) VHS slick image

results.title: Dot and the Bunny
results.brief_description: Dot ventures into the bush determined to finally locate the little lost Joey and reunite him with his mother the kangaroo. On her way she meets a silly bunny rabbit who tries to convince Dot that he is the lost Joey she is looking for. Dot politely explains to her new friend that Joeys have pouches and long tails, just like other kangaroos. Determined to convince Dot, the bunny fashions a pouch and a tail for himself from some shrubs and leaves. Dot is delighted and nicknames him Funny Bunny. Together they set out to search for the lost Joey and Dot tries to console Funny Bunny by explaining how important bunnies are especially at Easter.

results.title: Dot and Santa Claus
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: When Dot tells Santa Claus all about her wish to find her friend the Kangaroo’s lost Joey he offers to help and the two take to the air in Santa’s sleigh, pulled by two kangaroos. Their quest takes them all around the world and at each stop Santa teaches Dot about special Christmas traditions, including the origin of the Christmas carol “Silent night”. A delightful and entertaining musical adventure that is sure to bring glad tidings to all.

results.title: Dorothy Hewett
results.brief_description: Australia’s best known female playwright, Dorothy Hewett, looks back on her childhood influences and the place of music, poetry and art in her work.
results.description: Australia’s best known female playwright, Dorothy Hewett, looks back on her childhood influences and the place of music, poetry and art in her work.

results.title: Dorothea Lange. Pt. 2: the closer for me
results.creator_credit: Richard Moore, Robert Katz, Philip Greene and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description: Concentrates on Dorothea Lange’s renowned work on the Farm Security Administration (FSA) project during the depression. Also looks at her photographs during the war and a project on urban sprawl in California which occupied her during the last years of her life. Lange reviews these images and talks about her belief that photography is a universal language. Photographed by Phillip Greene.

results.title: Dorothea Lange. Pt. 1: under the trees
results.creator_credit: Richard Moore, Robert Katz, Philip Greene and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description: An intimate view of Dorothea Lange filmed during the last year of her life as she worked on a retrospective exhibition for the Museum of Modern Art. As she reviews her work, she is self critical and revealing, explaining how she felt when she took certain pictures. Most famous for her rural images during the depression, particularly the photograph ‘Migrant Mother’. Photographed by Phillip Greene.

results.title: Dorothea [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Wendy Chandler, Anna Grieve and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A young Greek woman, Dorothea, escapes her family’s resistance to adopting new ways and an arranged marriage by becoming involved in a theatre group and falling for the lead performer. Cast includes Helen Dullas, William Dye and Saavas Panas.
results.description: A young Greek woman, Dorothea, escapes her family’s resistance to adopting new ways and an arranged marriage by becoming involved in a theatre group and falling for the lead performer. Cast includes Helen Dullas, William Dye and Saavas Panas.

results.title: Doris Lessing
results.creator_credit: John Archer and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Well known writer Doris Lessing is interviewed about her life in Africa and the books she has written including “The grass is singing”, “The golden notebook”, “Briefing for a descent into hell”, and “Marriage between Zones 3,4 and 5”.

results.title: Dories
results.creator_credit: Ted Haley, Mike Mahoney, Rex Tasker and Whitman Trecartin
results.brief_description: Captain Albert Crouse, narrator of the film, used dories for fishing off the coast of Lunenberg, Nova Scotia. The film sketches the history of the dory. A local craftsman gives a step-by-step demonstration of the vessel’s construction

results.title: Doppler principles (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dept of the Air Force and Air Training Command
results.brief_description: Uses animation to present the phenomenon of the Doppler effect. Explains the effects on a transmitted wave when it encounters a moving object or when the transmitter itself is moving. Also explains the Doppler effect when the target is moving at various angles to the transmitter.
